page.title: 02THE HISTORY OF MIDDLESBROUGH
page.content: The first mention of a settlement at the mouth of the river Tees was in the seventh century. It was a very small stopping place in the middle of a journey made by monks and nuns from Whitby Abbey to Durham. The name Middlesbrough comes from Middlesburg, meaning a place in the middle. Middlesbrough was a very unimportant place, with just a few houses until the beginning of the nineteenth century. At this time many industries were being developed and iron and steel was needed to build ships and buildings. Iron ore was discovered at Eston and Cleveland hills and had to be transported around the country, so a dock had to be built on the river Tees for ships to collect iron ore.
